spanish.enphrase: The police found two corpses at the scene of the crime.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La policía encontró dos cadáveres en la escena del crimen.

spanish.enphrase: My cousin lost 100 Euros in the lottery scam.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi primo perdió cien euros con el timo de la lotería.

spanish.enphrase: From the main menu, select "options".
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: En el menú principal, selecciona "opciones".

spanish.enphrase: Bad luck, we couldn't get tickets to the concert.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Qué mala pata, no conseguimos entradas para el concierto.

spanish.enphrase: Alcohol is harmful to the liver.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El alcohol causa daños al hígado.

spanish.enphrase: My mother-in-law is the devil incarnate.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi suegra es el mismo demonio.

spanish.enphrase: The tea has to brew for a little bit longer.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El té tiene que infusionar un rato más.

spanish.enphrase: The butcher gave me this steak for free.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El carnicero me ha regalado este filete.

spanish.enphrase: It worked in the movie!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡En la película sí funcionó!

spanish.enphrase: One day we carved our names into the bark of that tree.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Un día tallamos nuestros nombres en la corteza de ese árbol.

spanish.enphrase: Dried fruits are rich in protein.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los frutos secos son ricos en proteínas.

spanish.enphrase: I want to be a writer when I grow up.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: De mayor quiero ser escritor.

spanish.enphrase: I'm two moves away from a check-mate.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me faltan dos movimientos para el jaque mate.

spanish.enphrase: I like cereal when it's still crispy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me gustan los cereales cuando todavía están crujientes.

spanish.enphrase: He wrote the script for his last movie himself.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Él mismo ha escrito el guión de su última película.

spanish.enphrase: There is a tsunami alert in this area.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hay una alerta de maremotos en esta zona.

spanish.enphrase: At the end of the film, the sheriff makes them bite the dust.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Al final de la película, el sheriff les hace morder el polvo.

spanish.enphrase: Most internet users are demanding faster connection speeds.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La mayoría de los internautas demanda un aumento de la velocidad de conexión.

spanish.enphrase: Dreadlocks don't look good on you.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Las rastas no te quedan bien.

spanish.enphrase: The footage of the accident was shocking.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Las imágenes del accidente fueron impactantes.

spanish.enphrase: What have you done to your sister? She's pouting again.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Qué le has hecho a tu hermana que está haciendo pucheros otra vez?

spanish.enphrase: When I wake up from napping I feel like I have cobwebs inside my head.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Cuando me levanto de la siesta siento que tengo telarañas en la cabeza.

spanish.enphrase: I want to spend the rest of my life by your side.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Quiero pasar el resto de mi vida a tu vera.

spanish.enphrase: The arrow hit the center of the target.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La flecha se clavó justo en el centro de la diana.

spanish.enphrase: My mother always sends me some nougat for Christmas.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 15 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi madre siempre me manda turrón en Navidad.

spanish.enphrase: I wouldn't watch that movie in a million years.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No vería esa película ni harto de vino.

spanish.enphrase: You should use an air freshener to eliminate the dog smell.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Deberías usar ambientador para eliminar el olor del perro.

spanish.enphrase: We have to get rid of our old furniture.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Tenemos que deshacernos de los muebles viejos.

spanish.enphrase: No pain, no gain.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Sin dolor no hay recompensa.

spanish.enphrase: His last movie has been controversial due to the sex scenes.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Su última película ha sido polémica por las escenas de sexo.

spanish.enphrase: I need one more sticker to finish my album.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me falta una pegatina para completar el álbum.

spanish.enphrase: The knight blocked the blow with his shield.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El caballero paró el golpe con su escudo.

spanish.enphrase: Shake hands and make up.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Estrechad las manos y haced las paces.

spanish.enphrase: I can walk and chew gum at the same time.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Puedo mascar chicle y caminar a la vez.

spanish.enphrase: I don't know how to change the keyboard layout.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No sé cómo cambiar la configuración del teclado.

spanish.enphrase: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: A diario una manzana es cosa sana.

spanish.enphrase: That's the last time I'm going to warn you.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Es la última vez que te lo advierto.

spanish.enphrase: Health is better than wealth.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La salud es la mayor riqueza.

spanish.enphrase: Laughter is the best medicine.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La risa es el mejor remedio.

spanish.enphrase: You'll have to rack your brains to solve that problem.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Tendrás que agudizar el ingenio para resolver ese problema.

spanish.enphrase: Can you bring me another napkin, please?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Me puede traer otra servilleta, por favor?

spanish.enphrase: Don't get carried away by anger.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No te dejes llevar por la ira.

spanish.enphrase: To err is human, to forgive divine.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El errar es humano, perdonar, divino.

spanish.enphrase: I feel too much distress, so I can't sleep.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La angustia no me deja dormir.

spanish.enphrase: The walls have ears.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Las paredes oyen.

spanish.enphrase: It's like talking to a wall.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Es como hablar a la pared.

spanish.enphrase: Where there's smoke, there's fire.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Donde hay humo, hay fuego.

spanish.enphrase: We're all a little crazy in one way or another.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: De cuerdo y loco todos tenemos un poco.

spanish.enphrase: I didn't sleep a wink all night because I had insomnia.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No he pegado ojo en toda la noche porque me desvelé.

spanish.enphrase: His son got into a fight and got a black eye.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Su hijo se peleó y le pusieron un ojo a la virulé.

spanish.enphrase: After the fight, his mother didn´t tell him off, so he got away with it.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Después de la pelea su madre no le regañó, así que se fue de rositas.

spanish.enphrase: Why don't you take off your coat and stay a while?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Por qué no te quitas el abrigo y te quedas un rato?

spanish.enphrase: I don't really need this, but it's on sale!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 16 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: En realidad no lo necesito, pero está de rebajas!

spanish.enphrase: The fight scene looked quite grotesque.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La escena de la pelea resultó bastante grotesca.

spanish.enphrase: "I am the one who can help you," mumbled John.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: "Yo soy el que te puede ayudar", musitó John.

spanish.enphrase: Don't fill my glass up.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No me llenes el vaso.

spanish.enphrase: Are you aware of the consequences of your actions?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Eres consciente de las consecuencias de tus actos?

spanish.enphrase: The sound of the explosion startled me.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me sobresaltó el ruido de la explosión.

spanish.enphrase: They spend their whole time quarrelling.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Se pasan la vida riñendo.

spanish.enphrase: He is a spoiled child.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Es un niño mimado de mamá.

spanish.enphrase: I am the master of my destiny.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Soy el amo de mi destino.

spanish.enphrase: What bad luck!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Qué mala suerte!

spanish.enphrase: At least he did something.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Por lo menos hizo algo.

spanish.enphrase: One shouldn't say swearwords here.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No hay que decir palabrotas aquí.

spanish.enphrase: You can keep the project going in my absence.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Puedes continuar con el proyecto en mi ausencia.

spanish.enphrase: He denied having received any money secretly.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Él negó haber recibido dinero bajo mano.

spanish.enphrase: Mum, I want to get on the Ferris wheel!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Mamá, quiero montarme en la noria!

spanish.enphrase: They sowed the seeds for a beautiful relationship.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Plantaron las semillas de una hermosa relación.

spanish.enphrase: Didn't your father-in-law object this time?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Esta vez no te puso peros tu suegro?

spanish.enphrase: My daughter works as a stewardess.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi hija trabaja como azafata.

spanish.enphrase: Basil is a culinary herb.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La albahaca es una hierba culinaria.

spanish.enphrase: I will be there as soon as I can.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Estare allí tan pronto como pueda.

spanish.enphrase: He is eaten up with jealousy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Le corroen los celos.

spanish.enphrase: He became frantic.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Se puso frenético.

spanish.enphrase: They defeated the enemies with the help of their friends.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Derrotaron a los enemigos con la ayuda de sus amigos.

spanish.enphrase: They live in a slum.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Viven en un tugurio.

spanish.enphrase: I miss having a garden.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Echo de menos tener un jardín.

spanish.enphrase: He won't go to sleep unless you tell him a story.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No irá a dormir a menos que le cuentes un cuento.

spanish.enphrase: Our neighbor has a pack of hounds.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Nuestro vecino tiene una jauría.

spanish.enphrase: I feel longing for my home because I'm living abroad.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Siento añoranza de mi tierra por estar viviendo en el extranjero.

spanish.enphrase: Everyone has heard the whisper of the wind through the treetops.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 17 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Todo el mundo ha oído el susurro del viento entre las copas de los árboles.

spanish.enphrase: We slept in the open.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Dormimos a cielo descubierto.

spanish.enphrase: I hope all my friends will come!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Ojalá que todos mis amigos vengan!

spanish.enphrase: What do you think about a blind date by webcam?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Qué tal una cita a ciegas por webcam?

spanish.enphrase: Drinking is OK as long as you don't do it in excess.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Uno puede beber siempre que no beba sin medida.

spanish.enphrase: The mayor of my town is excellent.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El alcalde de mi pueblo es excelente.

spanish.enphrase: Do not take it literally.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No te lo tomes al pie de la letra.

spanish.enphrase: My life is a mess and I don't know what to do.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi vida es un lío y no sé qué hacer.

spanish.enphrase: He asked me point-blank.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me lo preguntó a quemarropa.

spanish.enphrase: Dubai inaugurates the tallest skyscraper in the world.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Dubai inaugura el rascacielos más alto del mundo.

spanish.enphrase: Putting jigsaw puzzles together is a good mental exercise.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Armar rompecabezas es buen ejercicio para la mente.

spanish.enphrase: In the exam the candidates revealed their total lack of preparation.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los candidatos demostraron en el examen su absoluta falta de preparación.

spanish.enphrase: He did it to show off in front of his friends.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Lo hizo para presumir ante sus amistades.

spanish.enphrase: Notice: Closed Mondays
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Aviso: cerrado el lunes

spanish.enphrase: It's very useful to know Spanish idioms.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Es muy útil saber modismos del español.

spanish.enphrase: García accepted the crown with disgust.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: García aceptó la corona con repugnancia.

spanish.enphrase: The real curse is the ignorance.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La verdadera maldición es la ignorancia.

spanish.enphrase: Are you happy?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Estás contento?

spanish.enphrase: He started to study at the music academy in Vienna.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Empezó a estudiar en el conservatorio de Viena.

spanish.enphrase: Scientists worry about the Greenhouse Effect.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El efecto invernadero preocupa a los científicos.

spanish.enphrase: He failed in his attempt to beat the world record.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Fracasó en su intento de batir el récord mundial.

spanish.enphrase: Last night I had a sleepless night.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Anoche pasé una noche toledana.

spanish.enphrase: We had an argument about money.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Tuvimos una discusión por razones de dinero.

spanish.enphrase: The sixth item on the agenda has been the most interesting.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El sexto punto del orden del día ha sido lo más interesante.

spanish.enphrase: She advised her how to take care of her baby.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Le ha aconsejado cómo cuidar a su bebé.

spanish.enphrase: Let's get this party started.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Que empiece la fiesta.

spanish.enphrase: This book is called "The Barber of Seville."
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Este libro se llama "El barbero de Sevilla"

spanish.enphrase: To introduce the subject, I'll begin by discussing foreign policy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Para introducir el tema, empezaré hablando de política exterior.

spanish.enphrase: The majority of the population is destitute.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 18 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La mayoría de esta población es indigente.

spanish.enphrase: Her version of the events does not match up with the truth.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Su versión de los hechos no corresponde a la realidad.

spanish.enphrase: I used to go camping as a child.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: De pequeño solía ir de acampada.

spanish.enphrase: He insisted on going to work abroad.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Se empeñó en irse a trabajar al extranjero.

spanish.enphrase: May all your nightmares be sweet ones.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Que todas tus pesadillas sean dulces.

spanish.enphrase: When it stops raining we will go for a walk.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Cuando descampe iremos a dar un paseo.

spanish.enphrase: "Alone at dawn" is the movie directed by José Luis Garcia.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: "Solos en la madrugada" es la película dirigida por José Luis García.

spanish.enphrase: I don't care how the accommodation looks like provided it is clean.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me da igual el alojamiento con tal de que sea limpio.

spanish.enphrase: The very same day Francisco got sick as well.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El mismo día Francisco se ha puesto enfermo también.

spanish.enphrase: Certainly, I agree with all those who say that.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Pues sí, estoy de acuerdo con todos los que dicen eso.

spanish.enphrase: Spain is a beautiful country.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: España es un país muy bonito.

spanish.enphrase: I like the waves of the Black Sea.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me gustan las olas del Mar Negro.

spanish.enphrase: The police arrested a pick-pocket last night.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La policía detuvo a un carterista anoche.

spanish.enphrase: He is such a bore of a teacher.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Es un plomo de profesor.

spanish.enphrase: Food seems tasteless when one has a cold.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La comida parece sosa cuando uno está resfriado.

spanish.enphrase: Youth is but a state of mind.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La juventud no es más que un estado de ánimo.

spanish.enphrase: Hold this a moment.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Sujeta esto un momento.

spanish.enphrase: I've got to go now, see you soon!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Tengo que marcharme ahora, ¡hasta pronto!

spanish.enphrase: That night I slept like a log and I didn't hear anything.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Esa noche dormí a pierna suelta y no me enteré de nada.

spanish.enphrase: Baxter, you know I don't speak Spanish.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Baxter, sabes que no hablo español.

spanish.enphrase: The article on economics was very useful for my research.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El artículo sobre economía resultó muy útil para mi investigación.

spanish.enphrase: My nephew likes tales with goblins and fairies.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: A mi sobrino le gustan los cuentos de hadas y duendes.

spanish.enphrase: Doing daily exercise is a healthy activity.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hacer ejercicios diariamente es una actividad saludable.

spanish.enphrase: I don't have enough agility to play as a guard.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No tengo agilidad suficiente para jugar de base.

spanish.enphrase: It's too cold; you'd better wear something with long sleeves.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hace mucho frío; mejor ponte algo de manga larga.

spanish.enphrase: I'd rather receive the prize in cash.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Prefiero recibir el premio en efectivo.

spanish.enphrase: The contract has to be signed in front of a notary.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El contrato debe ser firmado ante notario.

spanish.enphrase: The Spanish Government passed its condolences on to Poland.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El gobierno español transmite sus condolencias a Polonia.

spanish.enphrase: She took off her slippers and put on her shoes again.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 19 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Ella se quitó las zapatillas y se puso de nuevo los zapatos.

spanish.enphrase: The flood victims were rescued in a helicopter.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Las víctimas de la inundación fueron rescatadas en helicóptero.

spanish.enphrase: I like to draw with crayon.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me gusta dibujar con lápiz de color.

spanish.enphrase: How about a nice game of chess?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Te apetece una partida de ajedrez?

spanish.enphrase: I would love to build a garden on the roof.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me encantaría construir un jardín en el tejado.

spanish.enphrase: I need to pay in cash. Is there an ATM here?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Necesito pagar en efectivo. ¿Hay cajeros automáticos por aquí?

spanish.enphrase: What is an artesian well?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Qué es un pozo artesiano?

spanish.enphrase: My flat is on the first floor.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi piso está en la primera planta.

spanish.enphrase: There are a thousand reasons to do it.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hay mil razones para hacerlo.

spanish.enphrase: I am soaked in sweat after running.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Después de correr acabo empapado de sudor.

spanish.enphrase: This chapter is very interesting.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Este capítulo es muy interesante.

spanish.enphrase: I don't like bitter coffee, I prefer it with a bit of sugar.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No me gusta el café amargo, lo prefiero con un poco de azúcar.

spanish.enphrase: He is a conference interpreter.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Él es un intérprete de conferencias.

spanish.enphrase: Let's dispense with the unnecessary details.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Prescindamos de los detalles inútiles.

spanish.enphrase: I want the orange marker.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Quiero el rotulador naranja.

spanish.enphrase: Where is the bucket?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Dónde está el cubo?

spanish.enphrase: I'll get you, my pretty, and your little dog, too!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Te atraparé, linda, y a tu perrito también!

spanish.enphrase: I'm not a saint.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No soy un santo.

spanish.enphrase: This address is unknown to me.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Esta dirección es desconocida para mí.

spanish.enphrase: Thanks for your support.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Gracias por tu apoyo.

spanish.enphrase: I want a piece a paper.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Quiero un pedazo de papel.

spanish.enphrase: At first I didn't know what to say.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Al principio no sabía que decir.

spanish.enphrase: In Europe there is housing shortage.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: En Europa hay escasez de viviendas.

spanish.enphrase: In the end I had to admit that he was right.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Al final tuve que darle la razón.

spanish.enphrase: He is very shy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Él es muy tímido.

spanish.enphrase: He offered me a bunch of flowers.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me ha regalado un ramo de flores.

spanish.enphrase: She hasn't gone yet.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Todavía no se ha ido.

spanish.enphrase: Take those dirty clothes off!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Quítate esa ropa tan sucia!

spanish.enphrase: Her eyes are like flames.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 20 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Sus ojos son como llamas.

spanish.enphrase: He hit his head against the wall.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Se dio con la cabeza contra la pared.

spanish.enphrase: We'll see things differently in the cold light of day.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Con la luz del día lo veremos de otra manera.

spanish.enphrase: I'm going to make him an offer he can't refuse.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Voy a hacerle una oferta que no podrá rechazar.

spanish.enphrase: These words brought three years of conflict to an end.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Estas palabras dieron fin a tres años de conflicto.

spanish.enphrase: When are you getting married?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Cuándo te casas?

spanish.enphrase: He did it for love.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Lo hizo por amor.

spanish.enphrase: There are cobwebs hanging from the ceiling.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hay telarañas colgando del techo.

spanish.enphrase: It's not the heat, it's the humidity.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No es el calor, es la humedad.

spanish.enphrase: My chest hurts.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me duele el pecho.

spanish.enphrase: He's such a liar!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Es tan mentiroso!

spanish.enphrase: You have nothing to lose.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No tienes nada que perder.

spanish.enphrase: It's very hot in here.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hace mucho calor aquí dentro.

spanish.enphrase: Here there is a church and a waterfall.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Aquí hay una iglesia y una cascada.

spanish.enphrase: You can't see the forest for the trees.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los árboles no dejan ver el bosque.

spanish.enphrase: Enough already!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡Basta ya!

spanish.enphrase: I have lost my key again.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: He perdido mi llave de nuevo.

spanish.enphrase: These are animals in danger of extinction.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Estos son animales en peligro de extinción.

spanish.enphrase: Some days require more coffee than others.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Algunos días requieren más café que otros.

spanish.enphrase: My suitcase is so heavy I can´t carry it.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi maleta es tan pesada que no puedo llevarla.

spanish.enphrase: Can someone tell me when we will arrive at the station?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Alguien puede decirme cuándo llegaremos a la estación?

spanish.enphrase: I have to drive, so I'll have an alcohol-free beer.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Tengo que conducir, así que tomaré una cerveza sin alcohol.

spanish.enphrase: I'll show you where it happened.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Te mostraré dónde ocurrió.

spanish.enphrase: Esmeralda in "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" was a gypsy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Esmeralda, de "El jorobado de Notre Dame", era gitana.

spanish.enphrase: It is not my fault.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No es mi culpa.

spanish.enphrase: Do you think that Hell will be such a bad place?
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¿Crees que el infierno será un lugar tan malo?

spanish.enphrase: The maiden could see her knight from the tower.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La doncella pudo ver a su caballero desde la torre.

spanish.enphrase: My work here is done.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi trabajo aquí ha terminado.

spanish.enphrase: Dark hair is very common in Latin America.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 21 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El pelo oscuro es muy común en Latinoamérica.

spanish.enphrase: I will never let you go.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Nunca te dejaré marchar.

spanish.enphrase: I need a hot coffee to start my working day.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Necesito café caliente para empezar mi día de trabajo.

spanish.enphrase: A smile is the best way to say "thank you".
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Una sonrisa es la mejor forma de decir "gracias".

spanish.enphrase: Once upon a time there was a circus that made our hearts happy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Había una vez un circo que alegraba siempre nuestros corazones.

spanish.enphrase: Close the door please, it's cold outside.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Cierra la puerta por favor, hace frío afuera.

spanish.enphrase: The victim got revenge on the wrongdoer.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La víctima se vengó del malhechor.

spanish.enphrase: I couldn't hide my disappointment after the defeat.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No pude ocultar la decepción tras la derrota.

spanish.enphrase: One should remain seated when the plane lands.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hay que quedarse sentado cuando el avión aterriza.

spanish.enphrase: We arrived without any mishap.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Llegamos sin ningún percance.

spanish.enphrase: Anxiety can bring about heartburn.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La ansiedad puede provocar ardor de estómago.

spanish.enphrase: Don't forget to flush the toilet.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No olvides tirar de la cadena.

spanish.enphrase: The election results were rigged.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los resultados electorales fueron amañados.

spanish.enphrase: The police arrived late at the robbery scene.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La policía llegó tarde a la escena del atraco.

spanish.enphrase: The printer is out of order.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La impresora está estropeada.

spanish.enphrase: The audience applauded the juggler.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los espectadores aplaudieron al malabarista.

spanish.enphrase: The file revealed a scandal.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El expediente destapó un escándalo.

spanish.enphrase: Some say that life is a highway.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Algunos dicen que la vida es una carretera.

spanish.enphrase: The criminal was sentenced to life imprisonment.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: El culpable fue condenado a cadena perpetua.

spanish.enphrase: After lunch, I can't stop yawning.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Después de comer no puedo dejar de bostezar.

spanish.enphrase: Check this bumpkin out. He's reading the paper but it's upside down.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Fíjate en el palurdo ese. Está leyendo un periódico pero está al revés.

spanish.enphrase: South American soap operas are great hits among housewives and kids.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 3 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Los culebrones sudamericanos son grandes éxitos entre las amas de casa y niños.

spanish.enphrase: Bringing teddy bears to school is not allowed.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Está prohibido traer ositos de peluche al cole.

spanish.enphrase: Her deeds were praiseworthy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Sus acciones fueron dignas de alabanza.

spanish.enphrase: My heart skipped a beat.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Me dio un vuelco el corazón.

spanish.enphrase: I can't work with these people!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡No puedo trabajar con esta gente!

spanish.enphrase: Calm down and don't freak out.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Cálmate y no pierdas los estribos.

spanish.enphrase: This milk's expiration date has come and gone!
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: ¡La fecha de caducidad de la leche ya ha pasado!

spanish.enphrase: During the break, snacks were served.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 22 Lesson 4 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Durante la pausa, se sirvieron tentempiés.

spanish.enphrase: Wanted: nanny for 2 kids.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Se precisa: canguro para 2 niños.

spanish.enphrase: To understand it all, I had to read it from the beginning to the end.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Para entenderlo, tuve que leerlo todo de cabo a rabo.

spanish.enphrase: Moving out is like starting from scratch.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Hacer el traslado es como si se partiera de cero.

spanish.enphrase: Her grandma is an old hag. She is so mean.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Su abuela es muy mala. Es una arpía.

spanish.enphrase: The fortune teller predicted your success.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La pitonisa predijo tu éxito.

spanish.enphrase: He says he traveled for business, but in reality it was monkey business.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Dijo que su viaje era oficial pero se trató realmente de un tejemaneje.

spanish.enphrase: I need half a kilo of ground meat.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 1 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Necesito medio kilo de carne picada.

spanish.enphrase: My dad brought us sugar-coated treats.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Mi padre nos trajo almendras garrapiñados.

spanish.translation: to be in a bad mood
spanish.enphrase: Don't talk to him. He is in a bad mood.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No hables con él. Está de mala leche.

spanish.enphrase: A little bit of salt will make it taste good.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: Un pelín de sal lo hace buenísimo.

spanish.enphrase: The Spanish team unleashed its fury, won, and raised the trophy.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: La Roja desató su furia, ganó y levantó el trofeo.

spanish.enphrase: I don't like my neighbor. She's a meddler.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No me gusta mi vecina. Es una entrometida.

spanish.enphrase: Don't be identified with them. They are losers.
spanish.notes: Practice today's word in Unit 23 Lesson 2 of the Word of the Day course in Transparent Language Online!
spanish.fnphrase: No te asocies con ellos. Son unos pringados.

spanish.enphrase: In spite of the problem, the show must go on.
